title: handle when "user home folder naming rule" directory can't be created/used
body:
when directory specified in ldap "user home folder naming rule" can not be created or used, owncloud issues no warning nor error message. the only symptom is that user can not upload anything and "personal" page says cryptic error: "you have used 0 b of the available 1 b"...

* the home directory specified in ldap field in my case is /home/${username}
* owncloud version is 4.5.12 from fedora package

imo either owncloud should use it's own naming scheme for ldap users as well and use info for ldap only for userdir-like subdirectories of home directory (or nfs mount or ...), or it should create the directory always as a subdirectory of it's own data directory.

this issue is the likely cause of https://mail.kde.org/pipermail/owncloud/2012-october/006174.html .
